revision.text:
'''Naushad Waheed''' (born [[December 15]], [[1962]] in [[Malé]]) is a cartoonist and painter in the [[Maldives]]. He was detained by the government for four months following the publication of one of his cartoons in the magazine ''[[Hukurum]]'' in [[1999]]. In [[2001]] he was arrested for participating in debates critical of the government, tried for treason, and sentenced to 15 years in prison. He was released on [[February 22]], [[2006]].
==External links== * http://www.naushadarts.com/ * [http://www.amnesty.ie/user/content/view/full/5292/ Amnesty International press release]
[[Category:1962 births|Waheed, Naushad]] [[Category:Living people|Waheed, Naushad]]

revision.text:
'''Naushad Waheed''' (born [[December 15]], [[1962]] in [[Malé]]) is a cartoonist and painter in the [[Maldives]]. He was detained by the government for four months following the publication of one of his cartoons in the magazine ''[[Hukuru]]'' in [[1999]]. In [[2001]] he was arrested for participating in debates critical of the government, tried for treason, and sentenced to 15 years in prison. He was released on [[February 22]], [[2006]].
==External links== * http://www.naushadarts.com/ * [http://www.amnesty.ie/user/content/view/full/5292/ Amnesty International press release]
[[Category:1962 births|Waheed, Naushad]] [[Category:Living people|Waheed, Naushad]] [[Category:Maldivian people]]
{{Maldives-stub}}

'''Naushad Waheed''' (born [[December 15]], [[1962]] in [[Malé]]) is a cartoonist and painter in the [[Maldives]]. He was detained by the government for four months following the publication of one of his cartoons in the magazine ''[[Hukuru]]'' in [[1999]]. In [[2001]] he was arrested for participating in debates critical of the government, tried for treason, and sentenced to 15 years in prison. He was released on [[February 22]], [[2006]]. Naushad Waheed is also the brother of [[Dr. Mohammed Waheed Hassan]], a former Member of Parliament, a leading political figure in the Maldives, and a hopeful for the 2008 Presidential Elections.
==External links== * http://www.naushadarts.com/ * [http://www.amnesty.ie/user/content/view/full/5292/ Amnesty International press release]
[[Category:1962 births|Waheed, Naushad]] [[Category:Living people|Waheed, Naushad]] [[Category:Maldivian people]]
{{Maldives-stub}}

In [[2001]] he was arrested for participating in debates critical of the government, tried for treason, and sentenced to 15 years in prison. He was released on [[February 22]], [[2006]]. Naushad Waheed is also the brother of [[Dr. Mohammed Waheed Hassan]], a former Member of Parliament, a leading political figure in the Maldives, and a hopeful for the 2008 Presidential Elections.

In [[2001]] he was arrested for participating in debates critical of the government, tried for treason, and sentenced to 15 years in prison. He was released on [[February 22]], [[2006]]. {{Unreferenced|date=May 2009}} '''Naushad Waheed''' (born [[December 15]], [[1962]] in [[Malé]]) is a cartoonist and painter in the [[Maldives]]. He was detained by the government for four months following the publication of one of his cartoons in the magazine ''[[Hukuru]]'' in [[1999]]. In [[2001]] he was arrested for participating in debates critical of the government, tried for treason, and sentenced to 15 years in prison. He was released on [[February 22]], [[2006]]. Naushad Waheed is also the brother of [[Dr. Mohammed Waheed Hassan]], a former Member of Parliament, a leading political figure in the Maldives, and a hopeful for the 2008 Presidential Elections.
==External links== * http://www.naushadarts.com/ * [http://www.amnesty.ie/user/content/view/full/5292/ Amnesty International press release] * [http://www.drwaheed.com/ Official website of Dr. Waheed, Naushad's brother]
[[Category:1962 births|Waheed, Naushad]] [[Category:Living people|Waheed, Naushad]] [[Category:Maldivian journalists]]
{{Maldives-stub}}

{{Unreferenced|date=May 2009}} '''Naushad Waheed''' (born [[December 15]], [[1962]] in [[Malé]]) is a cartoonist and painter in the [[Maldives]]. He was detained by the government for four months following the publication of one of his cartoons in the magazine ''[[Hukuru]]'' in [[1999]]. In [[2001]] he was arrested for participating in debates critical of the government, tried for treason, and sentenced to 15 years in prison. He was released on [[February 22]], [[2006]]. Naushad Waheed is also the brother of [[Dr. Mohammed Waheed Hassan]], a former Member of Parliament, a leading political figure in the Maldives, and a hopeful for the 2008 Presidential Elections. He is studying at Bolton University, working on his dissertation.<ref>http://www.bolton.ac.uk/News/News-Articles/2009/mar2009-2.aspx</ref> He was appointed as councillor at the high commission of Maldives to the UK. He has a wife, Aishath Hussain, and two sons, Nabi Naushad and Akyas Naushad.<ref>http://www.naushadarts.com/biography.htm</ref>
==External links== * [http://www.naushadarts.com/ Naushad Arts] * [http://www.naushadarts.com/biography.htm/ Naushad's Biography] * [http://www.amnesty.ie/user/content/view/full/5292/ Amnesty International press release] * [http://www.drwaheed.com/ Official website of Dr. Waheed, Naushad's brother] * [http://www.bolton.ac.uk/News/News-Articles/2009/mar2009-2.aspx/ High Commission role for Naushad]
[[Category:1962 births|Waheed, Naushad]] [[Category:Living people|Waheed, Naushad]] [[Category:Maldivian journalists]]
{{Maldives-stub}}

In [[2001]] he was arrested for participating in debates critical of the government, tried for treason, and sentenced to 15 years in prison. He was released on [[February 22]], [[2006]]. Naushad Waheed is also the brother of [[Dr. Mohammed Waheed Hassan]], a former Member of Parliament, a leading political figure in the Maldives, and a hopeful for the 2008 Presidential Elections.
